org.numenta.nupic

Enum Parameters.KEY

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Parameters.KEY>
      • org.numenta.nupic.Parameters.KEY
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Parameters.KEY>
    Enclosing class:
    Parameters

    public static enum Parameters.KEY
extends java.lang.Enum<Parameters.KEY>
    Constant values representing configuration parameters for the TemporalMemory

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ACTIVATION_THRESHOLD
      If the number of active connected synapses on a segment is at least this threshold, the segment is said to be active.
      AUTO_CLASSIFY 
      CATEGORY_LIST 
      CELLS_PER_COLUMN
      Total number of cells per column
      CLIP_INPUT
      if true, non-periodic inputs smaller than minval or greater than maxval will be clipped to minval/maxval
      COLUMN_DIMENSIONS
      Total number of columns
      CONNECTED_PERMANENCE
      If the permanence value for a synapse is greater than this value, it is said to be connected.

      Encoder name
      FIELD_ENCODING_MAP
      Designates holder for the Multi Encoding Map
      FIELD_NAME
      Name of the field being encoded
      FIELD_TYPE
      Primitive type of the field, used to auto-configure the type of encoder
      FORCED
      If true, skip some safety checks (for compatibility reasons), default false Mostly having to do with being able to set the window size < 21
      GLOBAL_INHIBITION
      If true, then during inhibition phase the winning columns are selected as the most active columns from the region as a whole.
      INHIBITION_RADIUS
      The inhibition radius determines the size of a column's local neighborhood.
      INITIAL_PERMANENCE

      LEARN
      Learning variable
      LEARNING_RADIUS
      Radius around cell from which it can sample to form distal DistalDendrite connections.
      LOCAL_AREA_DENSITY
      The desired density of active columns within a local inhibition area (the size of which is set by the internally calculated inhibitionRadius, which is in turn determined from the average size of the connected potential pools of all columns).
      MAX_BOOST
      The maximum overlap boost factor.
      MAX_NEW_SYNAPSE_COUNT
      The maximum number of synapses added to a segment during learning.
      MAX_SEGMENTS_PER_CELL
      The maximum number of Segments a Cell can have.
      MAX_SYNAPSES_PER_SEGMENT
      The maximum number of synapses that can be added to a segment.
      MAX_VAL
      The maximum value of the input signal.
      MIN_PCT_ACTIVE_DUTY_CYCLES
      A number between 0 and 1.0, used to set a floor on how often a column should be activate.
      MIN_PCT_OVERLAP_DUTY_CYCLES
      A number between 0 and 1.0, used to set a floor on how often a column should have at least stimulusThreshold active inputs.
      MIN_THRESHOLD
      If the number of synapses active on a segment is at least this threshold, it is selected as the best matching cell in a bursting column.
      MIN_VAL
      The minimum value of the input signal.
      N
      number of bits in the representation (must be >= w)
      NUM_ACTIVE_COLUMNS_PER_INH_AREA
      An alternate way to control the density of the active columns.
      PERIODIC
      If true, then the input value "wraps around" such that minval = maxval For a periodic value, the input must be strictly less than maxval, otherwise maxval is a true upper bound.
      PERMANENCE_DECREMENT
      Amount by which permanences of synapses are decremented during learning.
      PERMANENCE_INCREMENT
      Amount by which permanence of synapses are incremented during learning.
      POTENTIAL_PCT
      The percent of the inputs, within a column's potential radius, that a column can be connected to.
      POTENTIAL_RADIUS
      WARNING: potentialRadius **must** be set to the inputWidth if using "globalInhibition" and if not using the Network API (which sets this automatically)
      PREDICTED_SEGMENT_DECREMENT
      Amount by which active permanences of synapses of previously predicted but inactive segments are decremented.
      RADIUS
      inputs separated by more than, or equal to this distance will have non-overlapping representations
      RANDOM
      Random Number Generator
      RESOLUTION
      inputs separated by more than, or equal to this distance will have different representations
      SEED
      Seed for random number generator
      SP_PRIMER_DELAY
      Number of cycles to send through the SP before forwarding data to the rest of the network.
      STIMULUS_THRESHOLD
      This is a number specifying the minimum number of synapses that must be on in order for a columns to turn ON.
      SYN_PERM_ACTIVE_INC
      The amount by which an active synapse is incremented in each round.
      SYN_PERM_BELOW_STIMULUS_INC
      WARNING: This is a derived value, and is overwritten by the SpatialPooler algorithm's initialization.
      SYN_PERM_CONNECTED
      The default connected threshold.
      SYN_PERM_INACTIVE_DEC
      The amount by which an inactive synapse is decremented in each round.
      SYN_PERM_TRIM_THRESHOLD
      WARNING: This is a derived value, and is overwritten by the SpatialPooler algorithm's initialization.
      W
      The number of bits that are set to encode a single value - the "width" of the output signal
      WRAP_AROUND
      Determines if inputs at the beginning and end of an input dimension should be considered neighbors when mapping columns to inputs.

        Initial permanence of a new synapse

        public static final Parameters.KEY CONNECTED_PERMANENCE
        If the permanence value for a synapse is greater than this value, it is said to be connected.

      • PERMANENCE_INCREMENT

        public static final Parameters.KEY PERMANENCE_INCREMENT
        Amount by which permanence of synapses are incremented during learning.

      • PERMANENCE_DECREMENT

        public static final Parameters.KEY PERMANENCE_DECREMENT
        Amount by which permanences of synapses are decremented during learning.

        public static final Parameters.KEY PREDICTED_SEGMENT_DECREMENT

      • INPUT_DIMENSIONS

        public static final Parameters.KEY INPUT_DIMENSIONS

      • POTENTIAL_RADIUS

        public static final Parameters.KEY POTENTIAL_RADIUS
        WARNING: potentialRadius **must** be set to the inputWidth if using "globalInhibition" and if not using the Network API (which sets this automatically)

      • POTENTIAL_PCT

        public static final Parameters.KEY POTENTIAL_PCT
        The percent of the inputs, within a column's potential radius, that a column can be connected to. If set to 1, the column will be connected to every input within its potential radius. This parameter is used to give each column a unique potential pool when a large potentialRadius causes overlap between the columns. At initialization time we choose ((2*potentialRadius + 1)^(# inputDimensions) * potentialPct) input bits to comprise the column's potential pool.

      • GLOBAL_INHIBITION

        public static final Parameters.KEY GLOBAL_INHIBITION
        If true, then during inhibition phase the winning columns are selected as the most active columns from the region as a whole. Otherwise, the winning columns are selected with respect to their local neighborhoods. Using global inhibition boosts performance x60.

      • INHIBITION_RADIUS

        public static final Parameters.KEY INHIBITION_RADIUS
        The inhibition radius determines the size of a column's local neighborhood. A cortical column must overcome the overlap score of columns in its neighborhood in order to become active. This radius is updated every learning round. It grows and shrinks with the average number of connected synapses per column.

      • LOCAL_AREA_DENSITY

        public static final Parameters.KEY LOCAL_AREA_DENSITY
        The desired density of active columns within a local inhibition area (the size of which is set by the internally calculated inhibitionRadius, which is in turn determined from the average size of the connected potential pools of all columns). The inhibition logic will insure that at most N columns remain ON within a local inhibition area, where N = localAreaDensity * (total number of columns in inhibition area).

      • NUM_ACTIVE_COLUMNS_PER_INH_AREA

        public static final Parameters.KEY NUM_ACTIVE_COLUMNS_PER_INH_AREA
        An alternate way to control the density of the active columns. If numActiveColumnsPerInhArea is specified then localAreaDensity must be less than 0, and vice versa. When using numActiveColumnsPerInhArea, the inhibition logic will insure that at most 'numActiveColumnsPerInhArea' columns remain ON within a local inhibition area (the size of which is set by the internally calculated inhibitionRadius, which is in turn determined from the average size of the connected receptive fields of all columns). When using this method, as columns learn and grow their effective receptive fields, the inhibitionRadius will grow, and hence the net density of the active columns will *decrease*. This is in contrast to the localAreaDensity method, which keeps the density of active columns the same regardless of the size of their receptive fields.

      • STIMULUS_THRESHOLD

        public static final Parameters.KEY STIMULUS_THRESHOLD
        This is a number specifying the minimum number of synapses that must be on in order for a columns to turn ON. The purpose of this is to prevent noise input from activating columns. Specified as a percent of a fully grown synapse.

      • SYN_PERM_INACTIVE_DEC

        public static final Parameters.KEY SYN_PERM_INACTIVE_DEC
        The amount by which an inactive synapse is decremented in each round. Specified as a percent of a fully grown synapse.

      • SYN_PERM_ACTIVE_INC

        public static final Parameters.KEY SYN_PERM_ACTIVE_INC
        The amount by which an active synapse is incremented in each round. Specified as a percent of a fully grown synapse.

      • SYN_PERM_CONNECTED

        public static final Parameters.KEY SYN_PERM_CONNECTED
        The default connected threshold. Any synapse whose permanence value is above the connected threshold is a "connected synapse", meaning it can contribute to the cell's firing.

      • SYN_PERM_BELOW_STIMULUS_INC

        public static final Parameters.KEY SYN_PERM_BELOW_STIMULUS_INC
        WARNING: This is a derived value, and is overwritten by the SpatialPooler algorithm's initialization. The permanence increment amount for columns that have not been recently active

      • SYN_PERM_TRIM_THRESHOLD

        public static final Parameters.KEY SYN_PERM_TRIM_THRESHOLD
        WARNING: This is a derived value, and is overwritten by the SpatialPooler algorithm's initialization. Values below this are "clipped" and zero'd out.

      • MIN_PCT_OVERLAP_DUTY_CYCLES

        public static final Parameters.KEY MIN_PCT_OVERLAP_DUTY_CYCLES
        A number between 0 and 1.0, used to set a floor on how often a column should have at least stimulusThreshold active inputs. Periodically, each column looks at the overlap duty cycle of all other columns within its inhibition radius and sets its own internal minimal acceptable duty cycle to: minPctDutyCycleBeforeInh * max(other columns' duty cycles). On each iteration, any column whose overlap duty cycle falls below this computed value will get all of its permanence values boosted up by synPermActiveInc. Raising all permanences in response to a sub-par duty cycle before inhibition allows a cell to search for new inputs when either its previously learned inputs are no longer ever active, or when the vast majority of them have been "hijacked" by other columns.

      • MIN_PCT_ACTIVE_DUTY_CYCLES

        public static final Parameters.KEY MIN_PCT_ACTIVE_DUTY_CYCLES
        A number between 0 and 1.0, used to set a floor on how often a column should be activate. Periodically, each column looks at the activity duty cycle of all other columns within its inhibition radius and sets its own internal minimal acceptable duty cycle to: minPctDutyCycleAfterInh * max(other columns' duty cycles). On each iteration, any column whose duty cycle after inhibition falls below this computed value will get its internal boost factor increased.

      • DUTY_CYCLE_PERIOD

        public static final Parameters.KEY DUTY_CYCLE_PERIOD
        The period used to calculate duty cycles. Higher values make it take longer to respond to changes in boost or synPerConnectedCell. Shorter values make it more unstable and likely to oscillate.

      • MAX_BOOST

        public static final Parameters.KEY MAX_BOOST
        The maximum overlap boost factor. Each column's overlap gets multiplied by a boost factor before it gets considered for inhibition. The actual boost factor for a column is number between 1.0 and maxBoost. A boost factor of 1.0 is used if the duty cycle is >= minOverlapDutyCycle, maxBoost is used if the duty cycle is 0, and any duty cycle in between is linearly extrapolated from these 2 endpoints.

      • WRAP_AROUND

        public static final Parameters.KEY WRAP_AROUND
        Determines if inputs at the beginning and end of an input dimension should be considered neighbors when mapping columns to inputs.

      • SP_PRIMER_DELAY

        public static final Parameters.KEY SP_PRIMER_DELAY
        Number of cycles to send through the SP before forwarding data to the rest of the network.

      • N

        public static final Parameters.KEY N
        number of bits in the representation (must be >= w)

      • W

        public static final Parameters.KEY W
        The number of bits that are set to encode a single value - the "width" of the output signal

      • MIN_VAL

        public static final Parameters.KEY MIN_VAL
        The minimum value of the input signal.

      • MAX_VAL

        public static final Parameters.KEY MAX_VAL
        The maximum value of the input signal.

      • RADIUS

        public static final Parameters.KEY RADIUS
        inputs separated by more than, or equal to this distance will have non-overlapping representations

      • RESOLUTION

        public static final Parameters.KEY RESOLUTION
        inputs separated by more than, or equal to this distance will have different representations

      • PERIODIC

        public static final Parameters.KEY PERIODIC
        If true, then the input value "wraps around" such that minval = maxval For a periodic value, the input must be strictly less than maxval, otherwise maxval is a true upper bound.

      • CLIP_INPUT

        public static final Parameters.KEY CLIP_INPUT
        if true, non-periodic inputs smaller than minval or greater than maxval will be clipped to minval/maxval

      • FORCED

        public static final Parameters.KEY FORCED
        If true, skip some safety checks (for compatibility reasons), default false Mostly having to do with being able to set the window size < 21

      • FIELD_NAME

        public static final Parameters.KEY FIELD_NAME
        Name of the field being encoded

      • FIELD_TYPE

        public static final Parameters.KEY FIELD_TYPE
        Primitive type of the field, used to auto-configure the type of encoder

      • ENCODER

        public static final Parameters.KEY ENCODER
        Encoder name

      • FIELD_ENCODING_MAP

        public static final Parameters.KEY FIELD_ENCODING_MAP
        Designates holder for the Multi Encoding Map

        public static Parameters.KEY[] values()

        for (Parameters.KEY c : Parameters.KEY.values())
    System.out.println(c);
